for the future.( AP| KENNETH LAMBERT) to a reporter's question about whether there actually was evidence of any link between Saddam Hussein and terrorists seeking weapons of mass destruction. The Defense secretary responded: Reports that say that something hasn't happened are always interesting to me because, as we know, there are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. It is, of course, a logical fallacy to multiply categories beyond necessity, but it's one Donald Rumsfeld has rhetorically mastered to create a self-conscious reputation as a fearless questioner of received truths, one he's

. The CML predicts total advances for 2011 will be? 135bn, but warned that an early rise in interest rates due to inflationary pressures could slow consumer demand. CML economist Peter Charles said: Money market rates have recently moved higher in anticipation of a rise in base rate and some lenders have recently reflected these increases in their product pricing. "Against this backdrop, consumer demand may be weaker than we would otherwise have expected. "Higher interest rates will also hit the budgets of existing borrowers, although the expected modest rises in base rate will result in a relatively small proportionate rise in monthly payments for most mortgage holders. Chief Executive Officer Steve Ballmer plans to extend a management shake-up aimed at adding senior product executives with an engineering background, two people with knowledge of the decision said," Dina Bass reports for Bloomberg. Changes may be announced this month, said one of the people, who declined to be named because the plans are private, Bass reports. "Last month, Steve Ballmer pushed out server division president and 23- year company veteran Bob Muglia , saying the company needed new leadership that could focus on areas such as cloud software."
